title: Decision of the Council of Ministers No. (16) of 2019 Promulgating the Executive Regulation of the Law Regulating Tenders and Auctions Promulgated by Law No. (24) of 2015
title_en: Decision of the Council of Ministers No. (16) of 2019 Promulgating the Executive Regulation of the Law Regulating Tenders and Auctions Promulgated by Law No. (24) of 2015
description: Official legislation text retrieved from Al Meezan Legal Portal (English laws list source).

provisions.title: Article (1)
provisions.content:
In the application of the provisions of this Regulation, the following words and expressions shall have the meanings assigned thereto, unless the context otherwise requires:
Ministry
Ministry of Finance.
MinisterLaw
Minister of Finance.
Law on Regulating Tenders and Auctions promulgated by Law No. (24) of 2015.
Department
Department concerned with regulating the government procurement in the Ministry.
Government Body
Concerned ministry, government apparatus, authority, or public institution, as the case may be.
Head
The competent minister, government apparatus head, or head of authority or public institution, as the case may be.
Committee
Tenders and Auctions Committee established in accordance with Article (9) of the Law.
Competent Department
Competent administrative unit for tenders and auctions affairs in the Government Body.
Requesting Department
Concerned administrative unit in the Government Body, which estimates its needs of Items, Work Contracting or Services required to implement the tasks and competences entrusted thereto.
Items
All materials, commodities, equipment, machinery, and other goods and supplies, and the like.
Work Contracting
Construction and building works, other engineering contracting, installations, manufacturing, operation, maintenance, repairing, and the like.
Services
Technical, training and consultancy works, hiring of equipment and machinery, cleaning, insurance, guard, and transportation services, and the like.
Framework Contract
An agreement under which the contractor shall supply the Items, or implement the works or Services of the contract, upon the request of the Government Body, with the same prices stipulated therein throughout its term.
Approved Bank
Approved Insurance Company
A bank whose approval is issued by a decision of the Prime Minister, upon the proposal of the Minister, and after the approval of the Central Bank of Qatar, whether the bank is inside or outside the State.
Insurance company whose approval is issued by a decision of the Prime Minister, upon the proposal of the Minister, and after the approval of the Central Bank of Qatar, whether it is inside or outside the State.
Local Value
The total amounts spent by the contractor, supplier, or service provider within the country to develop national businesses, services, or human resources to stimulate productivity in the local economy, and it shall be determined through a certificate of previously executed contracts or the plan presented by the tenderer within the bid thereof, thereby demonstrating the target amount for the local value of contract value.
Contract Settlement
A final written agreement between the Competent Department and the contractor regarding the financial and contractual rights and obligations of each of them after the implementation or termination of the contract.
Chapter Two
Preliminary Procedures
Request of Needs

provisions.title: Article (2)
provisions.content:
The Requesting Department shall present its needs to the Competent Department, under purchase orders supported by a study on the level of importance of the requested needs, and such needs shall be actual, necessary and requisite for the workflow, and shall fall within the total needs approved when preparing the general State budget, or there are reasons and justifications found for contracting thereon.
The Competent Department shall, before the tendering, provide the Committee with what confirms the availability of necessary financial appropriation.
In all cases, the contracting shall not be with the intent of exhaustion of the financial appropriations prescribed for the Government Body.
Bases of Tendering

provisions.title: Article (3)
provisions.content:
Tendering shall be within the limits of actual needs estimated by the Government Body and on the basis of accurate and detailed technical specifications, specified by the Competent Department, in coordination with the Requesting Department, taking into account the Qatari standard specifications, and other specifications issued by or approved by the competent technical authorities.
Specifications of the tendering may include a maximum price limit for the Items, Work Contracting or Services to be contracted. Tendering in this manner shall be in the case of projects that require creative ideas.
The Competent Department, in coordination with the department, may also include in the offering conditions compliance with environmental, social and corporate governance practices.
By a decision from the Head, upon a presentation from the Competent Department, a specialized technical committee may be formed to develop the required specifications, in cases so require.
Specifications of TenderingArticle (4)
Specifications, on the basis of which the tendering is conducted, shall be general, without specifying the country of origin, specific mark or specifications that apply to special or distinctive models.
The provision of the preceding paragraph shall not be applied to the requirements related to the provision of maintenance services, spare parts or programs associated with devices and equipment used within the Government Body.
Request of SamplesArticle (5)
In the cases where the tendering is based on submission of samples, their weight, measurement or size shall be stipulated, and for the Items that shall be supplied in containers, the type, capacity and specifications of such containers shall be stated.
The bidder shall submit samples to the body specified in tender conditions on the dates prescribed therefor against a receipt, and the bid not accompanied by such samples shall not be accepted. The Competent Department shall be entitled, in coordination with the Requesting Department, after the approval of the Committee to view the samples at the showrooms of bidders who applied to the tender, in cases which require that.
Return of Samples

provisions.title: Article (6)
provisions.content:
The samples shall be returned to the rejected bidders within seven working days from the date of rejection, and if they did not receive them, in spite of notifying them thereof, the Competent Department may destroy or donate them, according to what it deems appropriate.
The samples submitted by the contractor shall be kept with the Competent Department or the Requesting Department, throughout the validity period of the contract. As far as returning these samples is concerned, the same provisions related to returning samples of the rejected bidders shall apply.
In case of damage of the samples submitted by the contractor for any reason, during supply period, the Competent Department or the Requesting Department shall keep a part of the supplied Items, which have been accepted, as alternative samples to be guided by in receiving the remaining Items.
Evaluation by Points

provisions.title: Article (7)
provisions.content:
In cases of technical nature that requires evaluation of the bids by points system, the tendering conditions shall include evaluation elements and bases, details and bases for obtaining the points, determination of evaluation points, and the minimum level for technical acceptance of each element, after their approval by the Committee. The most important of such elements are the following:
Period of experience in the field required to be implemented.
Technical and administrative staff working with the bidder on a permanent basis.
Projects that have been successfully implemented and the value of the highest project.
Licenses of practising technical works of the specialized nature.
Financial ability of the bidder through an audited budget.
Equipment, machinery and devices available to the bidder, which are necessary to accomplish the required work.
Any data or information that the Government Body deems necessary.
The Competent Department, in coordination with the Requesting Department, shall undertake to allocate points for each element in accordance with the nature of the tender subject and its importance.
The bid of the lowest price, which has the minimum level for technical acceptance, shall be awarded.
Evaluation by points may be based on the calculation of common points for technical and financial acceptance together. In such case, the bidder who gets the highest points in the common evaluation shall be awarded, provided that the price submitted thereby is within the limits of the estimated value or the limit that is accepted by the Committee.
Tendering Approvals and Documents

provisions.title: Article (8)
provisions.content:
Before tendering, the Competent Department shall obtain approvals and licenses required for the tender subject from the concerned authorities in the State.
The Competent Department shall prepare the tendering documents well in advance before starting the tender, to be delivered to whoever requests them, after paying the cash prescribed in the announcement.
The Committee may, on the recommendation of the Competent Department, waive the value of the documents. The documents shall include the following:
Tender announcement form.
Tender (Bid) form.
General instructions and conditions of the tender, which are the legal provisions that must be considered by the bidder when submitting his bid.
Special conditions of the tender, which are the technical matters that are unique to each tender according to its type.
Tender bond and performance bond forms.
Charts of detailed and accurate quantities showing the units of the Items.
Fully detailed drawings and specifications.
Contract form.
Elements and bases of evaluation, and details and bases of obtaining the points.
General conditions for contracting prepared by the Government Body, after notifying the Department.
Any other relevant documents the Department deems necessary to be added after coordinating with the Competent Department.
Language of Contracting Documents

provisions.title: Article (9)
provisions.content:
Documents of the tenders, auctions and contracts shall be prepared in Arabic language, or in English language and in such case a summary translated into Arabic language shall be submitted.
Bids submission shall be in Arabic language. In exception thereof, by approval of the Committee and in accordance with the requirements of the public interest, documents prepared in another language may be accepted provided that they are accompanied by a summary translated into Arabic language.
Estimated Value

provisions.title: Article (10)
provisions.content:
The Requesting Department shall, in coordination with the Competent Department, undertake to develop the estimated value for the contract subject, provided that it is similar to the market prices at the time of tendering, taking into consideration all affecting elements according to circumstances and nature of the contract.
Chapter Three
Tenders and Auctions Committee
Committee’s Competences

provisions.title: Article (11)
provisions.content:
The Committee shall be competent to:
Conduct the tenders, auctions, practices, competitions, and direct agreement in accordance with the provisions of the Law and this Regulation.
Announce tenders and competitions and invite companies qualified for the limited tenders in two phases and practices, in accordance with provisions of the Law and this Regulation.
Receive, open, study and evaluate the bids, as the case may be, and make a recommendation on awarding it to the best bid, in accordance with controls and procedures stipulated in the Law and this Regulation.
Study and evaluate the amendment requests of supply contracts, Work Contracting and Services, and issuing instructions in this regard.
Submit recommendations to the Head regarding any violations related to the application of the provisions of the Law and this Regulation.
Study the requests for settlement of contracts submitted by the Competent Department and express opinion thereon unless it includes a request for compensation by the contractor.
Contract settlement requests shall be submitted by the Competent Department to the Committee after agreeing with the contractor to terminate the contract, according to a document signed by the Government Body and the contractor, submitted to the Committee explaining the final financial and contractual rights and obligations of each of them after the implementation of the contract.
Membership Duration

provisions.title: Article (12)
provisions.content:
The duration of the Committee membership shall be three years, renewable for further similar period or periods.
Modus Operandi of theCommittee

provisions.title: Article (13)
provisions.content:
The Committee shall hold its meetings, upon an invitation from the Head thereof or the vice-chairman, whenever needed, and venue and time of its holding shall be specified in the invitation. The Committee meetings shall be valid only by attendance of the majority of its members and two observer members. In case of absence of the Head of the Committee and its vice-chairman, the Committee shall be chaired by members with the highest degree, and in case of equal degree, the chairmanship is for the eldest member. It is not permissible for one of the members to be an administrative subordinate to the Head of the meeting, nor it is permitted for the Committee meetings to be chaired by an employee of the Competent Department.
The Department and State Audit Bureau shall be notified of the meeting of the Committee to be attended by representative from each of them, at least one working day before its meeting, provided that the notification includes the agenda and the related attachments. In such case, the electronic means may be used. The Department and State Audit Bureau shall specify the appropriate method for notifying each of them. In emergency cases, the notification period may be reduced so that it will be in due time prior to the Committee meeting.
The observer member is entitled to view the subject documents listed in the agenda of the Committee before its meeting. He may ask any question or enquire from the Committee about the subjects, express his views, observations and reservations orally during the meeting, and confirm such things in the work minutes of the Committee and the decisions issued therefrom, sign them, and obtain a copy of them and of minutes of the envelopes opening and decision.
The Committee may form one or more sub-committees from among its members, provided that their meetings are attended by the two observer members, to open bids envelopes or study any matter presented to them, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in this Regulation, provided that they submit their recommendations to the Committee to take the decision. In cases where the sub-committee is assigned to open the bids envelopes, the tenders after they are opened may be referred to the Competent Department directly. In all cases, no tender shall be excluded except by the meeting of the Committee in accordance with the majority required for the validity of its meetings.
The Committee shall invite, to attend its meetings, whom it deems helpful from among the Government Body employees or others with expertise in the contract subject, without being entitled to vote.
The Committee shall issue its recommendations by the majority of votes of attending members, and in case of an equality of votes, the Head shall have the casting vote.
The Committee may issue its recommendation to pass the recommendation if necessary, provided that the recommendation is passed on to the two observer members prior to its issuance and the subject is included in the next meeting to be signed by the members. In such case, the subject shall contain all papers and documents relating thereto. The recommendation to pass shall be issued unanimously, by any means of electronic or written communication, in accordance with the controls established by the Department.
Committee’s Correspondences and Minutes

provisions.title: Article (14)
provisions.content:
Minutes shall be taken for each meeting of the Committee, in which the works, recommendations, and decisions of the Committee and reservations of the members, if any, shall be listed, and it shall be signed by the Head of the meeting and the attending members including the two observer members and the secretary.
The minutes shall be kept with the Committee secretary, according to the sequence of their numbers and dates of their sessions.
All correspondences, letters, publications and instructions of the Committee shall be signed by its Head or vice-chairman. By a decision of the Committee, administrative correspondence may be signed by the secretary of the Committee.
The Committee may use electronic means in holding its meetings and doing its transaction, including taking the minutes of its meetings, expressing its recommendations and issuing its letters, in a way that ensures validity of signature of the members and on all the minutes and the correspondences of the Committee.
Conflict of Interests

provisions.title: Article (15)
provisions.content:
Head or vice-chairman of the Committee or any of its members shall not have direct or indirect interest in the subjects presented to the Committee, and also, none of them shall be a partner with one of the bidders of tenders or auctions, his agent, a member in his board of directors, or an employee with him, whether the bidder is a natural or legal person.
If any of the things mentioned in the preceding paragraph is found in relation to the Head, vice-chairman or member, he must disclose that and desist from participating in the proceedings of such subjects.
To combine chairmanship or membership of the Committee and approval of its recommendations shall not be allowed.
Confidentiality of the Committee's Works

provisions.title: Article (16)
provisions.content:
All works of the Committee and its deliberations shall be confidential, and all its workers shall maintain such confidentiality, and shall not disclose any of its works. The obligation of maintaining confidentiality shall include any employee who participated in the tenders or viewed any of its procedures by virtue of his job.
Approval of the Committee's Recommendations

provisions.title: Article (17)
provisions.content:
Taking into account the validity period of the bids, the Head shall approve or object to the committee's recommendation within (20) twenty working days as a maximum from the date of its submission thereto. In case of objection of the Head to recommendation of the Committee, within the period provided for in the previous paragraph, the papers shall be returned to the Committee to be studied in the light of this objection, and its recommendation shall be submitted to the Head, within (3) three working days from the date of returning the papers to it. If the Committee insists on its recommendation, the Head must approve the recommendation of the Committee, within (10) ten days.
In all cases, the Committee's recommendations shall not be implemented except after the approval thereof.
Chapter Four
The Bond
Tender Bond

provisions.title: Article (18)
provisions.content:
Tender bond shall be submitted along with every bid. Its value shall be specified by the Competent Department in coordination with the Requesting Department, within the conditions of announcement or invitation, not exceeding (5%) five percent of the estimated value.
The bidder who does not submit the required tender bond shall be excluded.
By approval of the Head and upon a reasoned recommendation of the Competent Department, exemption from submitting the tender bond may be given before tendering in the following cases:
Tenders related to consultancy services.
Tenders related to technical, research, media, sponsorship and marketing services.
Tenders the value of which is less than (500,000) Riyals.
By approval of the Committee, in dividable supply tenders, it is allowed to specify the amount of the tender bond not exceeding (5%) five percent of the estimated value for each item separately, and in such case, the bidder shall submit the required tender bond for the Items he wishes to bid.
Submission of Tender Bond

provisions.title: Article (19)
provisions.content:
Tender bond shall be submitted in the name of the Government Body to the Committee, in the form of a payable cheque, or a letter of bank guarantee issued by a local or approved bank, which is not associated with any restriction or condition, and is valid for full payment, and is irreversible, provided that its validity period is not less than (120) one hundred and twenty days from the date specified for delivery of bids.
Cheques drawn from external banks shall be accepted, provided that they have been signed by acceptance by one of the local or approved banks and the local or approved bank undertakes to pay to the Government Body an amount equivalent to the required bond and it is committed to pay it in full at its first request without paying attention to any objection from the bidder.
Return of Tender Bond

provisions.title: Article (20)
provisions.content:
The tender bond shall be returned to the unaccepted bidders without the need for a request from them, within a period not exceeding seven working days from date of issuing non-acceptance decision, or from the bond expiry date without its renewal.
The tender bond shall be returned to the bidder who has been awarded, within a period not exceeding seven working days from the date of collecting the performance bond.
Value of the Performance Bond

provisions.title: Article (21)
provisions.content:
Value of the performance bond shall be specified in the conditions of the announced tender, in an amount not less than (10%) ten percent of the contract value, and it shall be deposited by an acceptable letter of bank guarantee from a local or approved bank, which is not associated with any restriction or condition, and is valid for full payment, and is irreversible.
The performance bond may be accepted by a certified cheque issued by a local or approved bank, which is not associated with any restriction or condition, and is valid for full payment, and is irreversible.
Guarantees from external banks shall be accepted, provided that they have been signed by acceptance from one of the local or approved banks and the local or approved bank undertakes to pay to the Government Body an amount equivalent to the required bond and it is committed to pay it in full at its first request without paying attention to any objection from the bidder.
The performance bond shall be retained in full until final completion of execution of the contract, including the warranty or maintenance period in accordance with the tender conditions.
By approval of the Head and upon a reasoned recommendation of the Competent Department, exemption from submitting the performance bond totally or partially may be given before tendering, in the tenders, auctions, practices and direct agreement related to the following cases:
Consultancy services.
Technical, research, media, sponsorship and marketing services.
If the value of the operation is less than (500,000) Riyals.
Warranty and maintenance services.
Notification of Awarding

provisions.title: Article (22)
provisions.content:
Subject to the provision of Article (69) of this Regulation, the Competent Department shall notify the bidder to whom the tender has been awarded to attend to submit the performance bond within (15) fifteen working days from the next day of notifying him of awarding, and to sign the contract within the period it specifies for him, provided that it shall not exceed (20) twenty working days from the date of submission of the performance bond.
For the contracts concluded with a contractor from outside the State, the bond may be submitted within (20) twenty working days starting from the next day of notifying him of awarding.
Upon approval of the Competent Department, the specified period for submission of the performance bond may, also, be extended, in the two cases stipulated in the preceding two paragraphs, for no more than five working days.
Return of Performance Bond

provisions.title: Article (23)
provisions.content:
The performance bond or the remaining part thereof shall be returned to its owner, without the need of a request from him, within a period not exceeding seven working days after final completion of execution of the contract, including the period of warranty or maintenance.
Part Two
Contracting Methods
Chapter One
Public Tender
Section One
Tendering Procedures and Bids Submission
Announcement of Public Tender

provisions.title: Article (24)
provisions.content:
Subject to the conditions, rules and provisions stipulated in the Law and this Regulation, the Committee shall undertake to announce the public tenders via the integrated website for State procurement and by any other means of announcement, in accordance with the controls specified by the Department.
The Data Included in Public Tender Announcement

provisions.title: Article (25)
provisions.content:
The announcement of the public tender shall include the following:
The tender number and the tender subject.
A brief statement of the Items, Work Contracting or Services required to be purchases or implemented.
The authority from which the tender documents are requested.
Price of copy of the tender documents, as specified by the Competent Department.
System of bids submission (one envelope or two envelopes).
The authority to which the bids shall be submitted and the deadline for submitting them.
The period specified for receiving the enquiries.
The date specified for opening the envelopes.
The amount of the tender bond and its validity period.
Validity period of the bid.
Performance bond required to be submitted and its validity period.
Statement of the right of the Government Body during the period of the contract, upon approval of the Committee, to increase or decrease the quantities of the Items, Work Contracting or Services, according to provisions of the Law and this Regulation.
Bids Validity Period

provisions.title: Article (26)
provisions.content:
The validity period of the bids shall be ninety days from date of expiration of the period prescribed for their submission, and the Competent Department may reduce this period for the tenders related to supplying the Items or materials which are subject to trading in the global stock markets.
The Committee may, for considerations of public interest, request the Bidders to extend the validity of the bids submitted thereby by no more than (10) ten working days.
Bids Submission

provisions.title: Article (27)
provisions.content:
The bids shall be submitted in two closed envelopes, one of them for technical bid and the other for financial bid. The technical envelope shall contain the tender bond, a copy of classification certificate and the data and documents that the Competent Department deems necessary to be provided to verify the matching of the technical bid with the required conditions and specifications, and the availability of the technical competence and financial capability of bidders in a way that is commensurate with the contract subject. The financial bid shall contain the prices submitted for the required Items in the tables of quantities.
As an exception to the provision of the preceding paragraph, it shall, with the approval of the Committee, in the case of offering the two-envelope system, give a period to the bidder to submit the tender bond, provided that the period does not exceed (5) five working days.
Upon approval of the Committee, based on a proposal from the Competent Department, a text may be included in the tender conditions, which states submission of the bids by one envelope system.
In cases of the tendering where submission of prices is not required, the bids may be submitted by technical envelope system only, provided that the conditions include evaluation system by points and, in such case, the value of tender bond shall be specified compared to the feasibility of the project intended to be tendered, provided that the value of the tender bond does not exceed the rates specified in Article (18) of this Regulation.
In all cases, the bids shall be submitted in one original and at least two copies in one file, and in case of difference between copies, the original copy shall prevail, provided that a copy of the bid shall be kept at the Requesting Department and the other copy at the Committee secretariat, and the original bid shall be kept at the Competent Department.
Bids Contents

provisions.title: Article (28)
provisions.content:
The technical bid shall include the following:
Technical bid form, and it shall include name of the company in Arabic or English language, trade name, if any, commercial register number and its expiration date if any, commercial activity, classification certificate number issued by the Department if any, tax debts clearance certificate, company partners, manager in charge, and the company address and its details.
Catalogues, fees, lists of quantities, data on types of materials, tasks, equipment, devices required to be supplied, method of operating them or method of implementing tender-subject works, timetable for completion and delivery, and the maintenance and warranty period if it is stipulated in the tender documents.
Statement of equipment and devices available to the bidder to accomplish the required work.
List of spare parts, operation requirements, with a statement of their consumption rates.
Data on names, jobs and expertise of staff entrusted to oversee implementation of the operation and experience period of the company in field of its work.
Name of the company which produces the Items and country of origin.
Subject to Article (32) of this Regulation, the financial bid shall contain the form of financial bid including total price in numbers and letters, and a copy of the certificate or plan specifying the local value, if any, as the case may be.
Period of Bids Submission

provisions.title: Article (29)
provisions.content:
The period specified for submitting the bids in public tenders shall be sufficient to enable bidders to submit their bids, and it shall not be less than (15) fifteen working days from date of announcement, and the Committee may shorten this period before offering if the public interest so requires.
Taking into account the provisions of Article (26 / second paragraph) of this Regulation, The Committee shall decide on the tender and inform the Competent Department and the bidder within the first (60) sixty days of the validity of the bid.
If the period of (60) sixty days provided for in the preceding paragraph expires without deciding on the tender for reasons related to its nature, the Committee shall decide on the tender during the remaining validity period of the bids.
Bidder General Obligations

provisions.title: Article (30)
provisions.content:
The bidder shall abide by the conditions stipulated in the tender documents, and he shall not make any kind of amendments to the tender documents. Except for the Framework Contracts, the bids that do not include valid fixed total prices, for the bid or Items in divisible tenders, during the validity period of the bid specified in announcement of the tender, shall not be accepted. The bidder shall not back out of it during such period.
If the bidder has any reservations or conditions, he shall state them clearly in the bid, provided that the word "reserved" is written thereon, to be taken into account at the time of evaluation.
Enquiries

provisions.title: Article (31)
provisions.content:
Submission of the bid shall be considered as an acknowledgement from its bidder that he has become acquainted with all the tender conditions, project plans and its specifications, and tables of quantities, and that he is aware of the site nature and its location, and all the matters related to implementation, completion and delivery of the contract in accordance with contract provisions, conditions and technical specifications.
Any enquiry related to the tender shall be submitted to the Competent Department within the period specified in the tender to receive enquiries and before the end of the date specified for submission of the bids. The Competent Department shall reply to such enquiries before the end of this date and shall notify the rest who received the tender documents of such reply.
Financial Bid Details

provisions.title: Article (32)
provisions.content:
Prices shall be submitted in Qatari currency, unless the tender documents state otherwise, and the bid shall include fixed total prices.
The bidder shall put his prices in tables of quantities (list of prices), taking into account the following:
Prices and units thereof shall be written in digits and letters, in inerasable way. In case of submission of the bid by non-Qatari company, prices may be written in foreign currency, provided that they are rated in the local currency according to the prices announced by Qatar Central Bank at the time of envelopes opening.
Every correction in the prices shall be rewritten and signed by the bidder.
Prices specified by the bidder in the prices table shall include all expenses and obligations of all kinds. They shall also include the completion of all works, their delivery to the Government Body and their warrantee according to the conditions of the contract. Attention shall not be paid to any claim of the bidder of occurrence of any mistake in his bid after being submitted to the Committee.
The bidder shall submit a list of prices of spare parts, if it is stipulated in the tender documents, provided that their prices are fixed during the period specified in the tender documents.
Dependence on the Local Markets

provisions.title: Article (33)
provisions.content:
Without prejudice to the agreements that the State is bound by, the tender conditions and draft contracts intended to be concluded with non-Qatari companies to execute works or provide services inside the State, except for consultancy services, shall contain a text to obligate those companies to depend on the local markets by a percentage not less than (30%) thirty percent of the total value of the contract, without prejudice to the conditions and specifications on basis of which the contract was made.
The percentage referred to shall include raw materials, locally manufactured materials, transportation services, security, guard and catering services and any other services provided by local companies to implement the contract concluded with the non-Qatari company.
Non-Qatari companies shall, before their reimbursement, submit contracts or invoices related to the Items, Services or Work Contracting that have been implemented by local companies, regarding the contract concluded with the non-Qatari company.
Priority in depending on the local markets shall be given to small, medium and environmentally friendly projects.
Upon approval of the Prime Minister, based on a reasoned recommendation of the Minister, the percentage referred to may be adjusted or any contract may be exempted from being committed to it or to a part thereof, due to the nature and privacy of the required Items, Work Contracting or Services, or for the public interest purposes.
Monitoring Concerning Commitment to Depending on the Local Markets

provisions.title: Article (34)
provisions.content:
Payment requests issued by the Competent Government Bodies shall contain a particular clause indicating the percentage of what was achieved by depending on the local markets by the contracted non-Qatari companies.
The Ministry shall undertake to monitor the disbursement of requests paid through it, and the Government Bodies, which pay the dues of the companies directly through them, shall verify the commitment of non-Qatari companies to depending on the local markets according to the prescribed percentage.
Lack of commitment of any non-Qatari company to achieve the percentage referred to shall be considered as a breach of its contractual obligations.
Insurance on Items, Work Contracting and ServicesArticle (35)
The contractor shall undertake to take out the necessary insurance, with one of the national or approved insurance companies, on the Items, Work Contracting and Services mentioned in the contract, the nature of which requires the insurance thereon, according to the tendering conditions.
Consortiums

provisions.title: Article (36)
provisions.content:
A consortium consisted of two or more companies may apply to the tender, under a consortium document certified by competent authorities.
Bids Submission Mechanism

provisions.title: Article (37)
provisions.content:
The bids shall be submitted within the time specified in the announcement, signed by their bidders on the bid form prepared by the Government Body and the tables of quantities attached thereto, placed inside closed envelopes, and the tender subject, tender number, and deadline for submitting the bids shall be written thereon, without any indication to the bidder.
The bidder or his delegate shall undertake to put the envelopes in the place prepared for such a purpose after each envelope being signed by the secretary and recording the delivery date and time.
Place Specified for Bids Submission

provisions.title: Article (38)
provisions.content:
A suitable place shall be allocated in the headquarters of the Government Body to receive the bids, in a way that ensures the keeping of their confidentiality and preventing them from being accessed by a single employee alone.
Without prejudice to the confidentiality of the bids, the bids may be received and opened by modern electronic means, in accordance with the controls and procedures specified by the Department.
Section Two
Envelopes Opening and Technical Evaluation
Opening Envelopes Mechanism

provisions.title: Article (39)
provisions.content:
Taking into account the nature of bids submitted electronically, the Committee shall open envelopes on the day and time specified for that in one session, and the Committee shall take the following actions according to their order:
Confirm the condition on which the bids have been received after verifying their safety.
Counting the bids and confirming their number in the minutes of the envelopes opening.
Verifying the existence of two separate envelopes submitted for each bid, in case of two envelopes system tendering, one for technical bid and the other for financial bid, and confirming that in the minutes of the envelopes opening.
Opening the technical or financial envelopes, as the case may be, sequentially. Each opened envelope shall be marked with the bid number, after numbering it as a common fraction where its numerator shall be the bid’s number and its denominator shall be the number of the submitted bids.
Keeping the financial envelopes closed after being signed, inside a tightly- sealed place.
Having the signatures of the Head of the meeting and attending members on the technical or financial bids and recording them in the minutes of opening.
Marking a circle around each erasure, scratch or correction in the data mentioned in the bid, and one of the members of the Committee shall sign on such marks.
Having the signatures of the Head of the meeting and the Committee members on minutes of the envelopes opening.
Keeping the tender bonds with the Competent Department until returning them, according to the procedures prescribed in this Regulation.
Opening Priority

provisions.title: Article (40)
provisions.content:
In case of tender submission via a two envelopes system, the technical envelopes shall be opened and studied first, and the financial envelopes for technically accepted bids shall be opened. Bidders of unaccepted bids shall be notified of the reasons of exclusion, to receive the tender bond within a maximum period of seven working days from the date of the notification.
As an exception to this, the Committee may open both technical and financial envelopes in a single session, if only one bid has been submitted for the tender, or if the public interest so requires; and also the Committee may open financial bids of the technically unaccepted bids for guidance in a way that does not affect the technical evaluation, provided that the Committee issues its decision by unanimity of views of the attending members in both cases.
Upon unanimity of views of the attending members, all the technical and financial bids may be opened, provided that the financial bids are kept with the Committee, and the technical bids of the five lowest price are referred to be studied technically first, then financially, for the technically accepted ones, provided that this shall be done successively in case of non-acceptance of first five bids, till the tender is decided upon.
Bids Study Referral

provisions.title: Article (41)
provisions.content:
Technical or financial bids, as the case may be, shall be referred to the Competent Department to study them, in coordination with the Requesting Department, and to submit its recommendation to the Committee within the period specified for it, provided that it shall not exceed (20) twenty working days to study the technical bids, and (10) ten working days to study the financial bids.
Mechanism for Studying the Technical Bids

provisions.title: Article (42)
provisions.content:
The Competent Department, while studying and evaluating the bids, shall take into account the following:
Assigning at least two of its employees or employees of the Requesting Department, in case of tendering via two envelopes system, to prepare technical study for the bids submitted for the tender, in coordination with the Requesting Department.
Not communicating with bidders, except through the Committee, to obtain the necessary clarifications and confirmations with regard to the bids submitted by them, and to attach to the study all the correspondence and responses it receives in this regard, without amending or changing the submitted bids, the prices stipulated therein, or the conditions and specifications on which the offer was based.
Indicating any reservations or conditions that would be mentioned by the bidder in his bid, and expressing opinion in this regard.
Bids study shall be clear and shall fulfill all the required technical elements and shall include detailed statement of the reasons on the basis of which it issues its recommendation, and not to suffice with the general expressions such as "Nonconformity", " Rejected" or "Violating".
In case of following the method of evaluating the bids by using points and percentages, bases of application of this method shall be indicated, and such bases and percentages shall be fully considered and shall be applied to all bidders when preparing its study.
Abiding by preference rules prescribed for national products and local value, in accordance with the legislation issued in this regard.
Formation of Technical Working Group to Study Bids

provisions.title: Article (43)
provisions.content:
If not satisfied with the recommendation of the Competent Department, the Committee may form a technical working group of experts, technicians or consultants from among employees of the Government Body or others, to study the submitted bids and submit its recommendation to the Committee.
Mandatory Nature of Recommendations Submitted to the Committee

provisions.title: Article (44)
provisions.content:
Recommendations of the bodies stipulated in the preceding three Articles shall not be binding upon the Committee, and the decision of the Committee contrary to such recommendations shall be issued by unanimity of views of the attending members, and if this unanimity is not available or the Committee failed to issue its decision within a maximum period of seven working days from date of presenting the recommendations to it, the matter shall be presented to the Head , and his decision in this regard shall be final.
Announcement of the Committee Decisions

provisions.title: Article (45)
provisions.content:
Decisions related to acceptance or awarding of the bids, or cancellation of the tender shall be announced on the integrated website for the State procurement, and the Committee shall undertake to notify the excluded bidders of the reasons of exclusion on their addresses mentioned in their bids.
Section Three
Deciding on Tender
Announcement of Awarding

provisions.title: Article (46)
provisions.content:
After approval of its recommendation for awarding, the Committee shall undertake to announce the prices submitted by the bidder who was awarded, on the integrated website for the State procurement.
Awarding

provisions.title: Article (47)
provisions.content:
The Committee shall meet at a time sufficiently prior to the end of the date specified for validity of the bids, to make its recommendation in respect of the tender.
The Committee shall recommend to award the tender to the best bid, and the preference shall be, basically, given to the bid which submitted the lowest total price, if it fulfils all the conditions and conforms to the required technical specifications, after unifying the bases of comparison between the bids from all technical and financial aspects.
By unanimity of views of the attending members, the Committee may recommend to award the tender to the bid of higher price directly, under a justified recommendation, in the following two cases:
If prices of the lowest bids are low in an unrealistic and non-reassuring way.
If quality levels submitted by the bids are varying, and the difference between the lowest price and the higher price is very tiny in comparison with the difference in quality.
In cases where the value of the best bid is higher than the estimated value, the Committee may award its bidder.
In all cases, the Committee shall, prior to making its recommendation to award the tender, ensure that the financial allocations necessary for the tender are available.
As an exception to the foregoing, awarding of tenders in which the local value is applied shall be to the best bid, and preference shall be given to the bid that presented the lowest financial result after calculating a percentage of the local value submitted by the bidders if it fulfills all the conditions and conforms to the required technical specifications, after unifying the foundations comparison between bids in all technical and financial aspects, provided that the Department specifies the bids and the necessary controls for this after the approval of the Minister.
Dividing the Awarding

provisions.title: Article (48)
provisions.content:
Without prejudice to specifications and deadlines specified for delivery of the Items, the Committee may, if two or more bids have the same price in the tenders of purchase of the Items, divide the required quantities between these bids.
In all cases, the tender of purchasing and hiring the Items and providing Services may be divided and awarded to more than one bidder based on the lowest prices, without prejudice to the specifications and coherence of the tender materials.
Total Price and Arithmetical Error

provisions.title: Article (49)
provisions.content:
Total price indicated in the bid form shall be considered, and the other numbers or any mistake made by the bidder during the calculation of the total price of his bid shall be disregarded, and he is not allowed to make any adjustment to this price after submitting his bid.
If it is found, after checking the bid and auditing of the price units, that the total price indicated in the bid form does not match the correct total price, the lowest total price shall be considered in such case.
If the arithmetic error exceeds (5%) five percent of the total price value indicated in the bid form, the bid shall be excluded, unless the Committee considers, by unanimity of views of the attending members, to accept it, provided that it is done with the consent of the bidder.
The total price written in letters shall be considered, if there is a difference between it and the total price written in digits.
Bidder’s Silence on Specifying the Prices of One of the Items

provisions.title: Article (50)
provisions.content:
If the bidder, in the tenders of purchase of the Items, becomes silent on specifying the price of one of the Items mentioned in the tables of quantities, it shall be considered as his refraining from his part from entering into the tender with respect to such item.
If the bidder, in Work Contracting, becomes silent on specifying the price for one of the Items in the contract works, the Committee may exclude the bid, except if the word "included" has been written next to such item, then the Committee may request details of the individual price value of such item.
In all cases, the total price may not be adjusted by increase in what is listed in the bid form.
Refunding the Documents Price

provisions.title: Article (51)
provisions.content:
If the tender is cancelled before the date specified for bids opening, the Competent Department has to refund the price of the documents and their attachments to those who bought them. However, if the cancellation is after the mentioned date, such price shall be refunded only to those who applied for the tender.
Also, the price of the documents shall not be refunded if the tender is cancelled for the reason of non-conformity of the bids with specifications or conditions or for high prices.
Grievances

provisions.title: Article (52)
provisions.content:
The withdrawing bidder who has been subjected to any of the sanctions stipulated in Article (12) of the Law, may raise grievance against such decision to the Head within seven working days from date of notifying him thereof.
The Head shall undertake to decide on the grievance within seven working days from date of its submission, and the Competent Department shall undertake to notify the grievant of the decision on the grievance, on his address mentioned in the bid by any knowledge proving means. No-reply within such period shall be considered as an implicit rejection of the grievance. The decision of the Head deciding on the grievance shall be final.
Section Four
Framework Contracts
Framework Contracts Cases

provisions.title: Article (53)
provisions.content:
In the cases of frequent purchase of the Items, Work Contracting or Services, or in the case of inability to specify the quantity or volume of the Items, Work Contracting or Services required beforehand, the Government Body, after asking opinion of the Department, may contract thereon through Framework Contracts.
Framework Contracts shall be concluded through tender, practice, or direct agreement and they shall include specifying the prices of the Items, Work Contracting or Services during a specific period of time, in accordance with the controls specified by the Department.
Framework Contracts Data

provisions.title: Article (54)
provisions.content:
Framework Contracts shall include the following data:
Contract parties.
Contract term.
Prices during the contract term.
Required Items, Work Contracting or Services, and their minimum and maximum limit, as the case may be.
Implementation mechanisms.
Method of payment and return of the performance bond value, as specified by the Department.
In all cases, without prejudice to the provisions and procedures stipulated in this Regulation and texts of the Framework Contract, the Government Bodies may, after approval of the Committee, contract on Items, Work Contracting or Services outside the scope of the Framework Contract, if they manage to get better value for the same contracted Item, Work Contracting or Service.
The Requesting Department shall, in coordination with the Competent Department, specify the estimated value of the Framework Contract, which shall be calculated on the basis of prices of the Items or Work Contracting or Services that are the subject matter of the contract within the period specified therein, and the tender bond and performance bond shall be calculated of the one-fifth of the maximum value of Items or Work Contracting or Services.
As an exception to the provision of Article (47) of this Regulation, preference may be given in awarding Framework Contracts related to the supply of items or services whose price is specified by the State or its source to the tenderer who offered the lowest profit margin on the specified amount or the highest discount rate, depending on the nature of the tender.
Collective Purchase

provisions.title: Article (55)
provisions.content:
Subject to the provision of Article (31) of the Law, the concerned Government Body shall, upon the proposal of the Department, collect information on standard and commonly used goods and Services in Government Bodies and standardize specifications of such goods and Services.
With the approval of the Head in each authority, one of the Government Bodies may act on behalf of other Government Bodies, upon the proposal of the Department, in concluding a collective purchase contract, to contract on supplying the Items or performing Services from one or more sources to get the best prices.
With the approval of the Minister, upon the proposal of the Department, it is permissible to conclude a collective purchase contract on supplying Items or performing Services for more than one Government Body.
The Competent Department may, in coordination with the Requesting Department in each body, purchase directly from the contracted sources by collective purchase, without presenting to the Committee, provided that the appropriation is available to that body according to the contract prices.
After the approval of the Minister, the Department shall set controls and procedures of the collective purchase.
Chapter Two
Two- stage Tender
The Announcement of the Two-stage Tender

provisions.title: Article (56)
provisions.content:
The two-stage tender contracting shall be made through the decision of the Head, upon a reasoned recommendation of the Committee.
In the first stage, the Committee shall announce the request for the submission of initial bids not associated with price fixing, which include technical proposals for the Items, work contracting or Services planned to be contracted, as well as proposals related to conditions of the contract and supply, and information about competency and qualifications of bidders. The announcement shall also include evaluation standards of the submitted initial bids.
The tender documents shall be delivered without charge in the first stage, and the receiver of the tender documents may request any enquiries or information about its subject within the period specified in tender documents.
The Competent Department shall notify the Committee and all bidders of responses to the mentioned enquires once they have been finalized.
The Evaluation of the Initial Bids

provisions.title: Article (57)
provisions.content:
The Competent Department shall, in coordination with the Requesting Department, evaluate the initial bids received according to the announced standards and bases, after being studied, and requesting any additional information or clarifications from bidders after the approval of the Committee, provided that the initial bids that are inconsistent with the mentioned standards are excluded.
Companies Invitation for the Second Stage

provisions.title: Article (58)
provisions.content:
In the second stage, in coordination with the Requesting Department, the Competent Department shall prepare final documents of the tender, including technical specifications on the basis of which the invitation is to be sent.
The Committee shall undertake the invitation for the second stage, in this stage, the invitation shall be limited to the accepted initial bidders, to submit their final technical and financial bids to the Committee.
Chapter Three
Limited Tender and Qualifying Companies
Cases of contracting by Limited Tender

provisions.title: Article (59)
provisions.content:
Limited tender contracting shall be made through the decision of the Head, upon a reasoned recommendation of the Committee in the cases that the nature thereof requires the participation to be limited to a limited number of certain suppliers, contractors, service providers, consultants, or self-designated technicians, from among those designated by the Department and listed in the lists prepared by the Government Body for such purpose, and the Committee shall adopt it, provided that they have the technical and financial competencies, and good reputation.
In case of the absence of lists of companies qualified for the subject of tender planned to be released, the Government Body shall qualify the available companies, as a first stage, and invite the accepted companies, as a second stage.
The Mechanism of Qualifying Companies

provisions.title: Article (60)
provisions.content:
Qualifying the Companies to apply for the limited tender, shall be in accordance with the following procedures:
The Competent Department shall submit its desire to the Committee to qualify the companies for the tender, provided that it indicates in its request the conditions, rules and bases on which the qualifying process will be carried out, and if adopted by the Committee, the qualification shall be announced, and the documents may be delivered free of charge.
The Committee shall undertake the announcement on the integrated website for State procurement, the desire thereof to qualify the companies specialized in the Works Contracting, required Items or Services, and the announcement shall include detailed description of tender subject, the address from which qualification documents can be obtained, deadline for submission of these documents and the authority to which they shall be delivered, with the need to specify suitable time period to prepare qualification documents by the companies. And the Competent Department shall respond to all the enquiries relating to the qualifying process within three working days from the date of submission thereof, provided that the Committee shall be notified thereof.
If the evaluation is on the basis of points, the specification of standards, bases, points coefficient, percentage of the minimum limit for acceptance, on the basis of which the companies submitting the qualification documents shall be finally qualified, shall be considered.
The Competent Department shall present the final list of the qualified companies to the Committee, indicating reasons and justifications of non-acceptance the qualification of some companies, if found, so as the Committee undertakes the necessary procedures to invite the qualified companies.
In addition to the announcement on the website, the announcement may be made by any other means, in accordance with the controls specified by the Department.
Qualification Documents

provisions.title: Article (61)
provisions.content:
The qualifying documents shall contain data and information of the companies wishing to be qualified, and which are:
Technical experience in the works subject of the tender.
Technical and administrative staff.
Value of the projects previously implemented by the company.
Licenses of practicing technical works of specialized nature.
Financial ability through an audited budget.
Any data or information the Government Body considers requesting.
Invitations and Receipt of Bids

provisions.title: Article (62)
provisions.content:
The Committee shall invite the companies that have been qualified by letters sent by mail, fax, electronic means of communication or by any other means that ensures the delivery of the invitation, provided that the submission of bids shall be in sealed envelopes handed over to the Committee, and the invitation shall include all data that must have been mentioned in the announcement of the public tender.
Chapter Four
Practice
Contracting through Practice Cases

provisions.title: Article (63)
provisions.content:
Contracting through Practice shall be made through a decision of the Head, upon a reasoned recommendation of the Committee, to purchase Items, implement works contracting, or provide Services, required in urgent cases, as well as Items, works contracting or Services offered in tenders and there are no bids submitted for their regard, or there are bids submitted with unacceptable prices, and there is an urgent need for them that does not allow them to be retendered again.
The necessary approvals and licenses may be completed by the competent authorities in the State, in accordance with the provisions of Article (8) of this Regulation during tendering through practice and prior to the award, and the Competent Department shall submit all such approvals to the Committee when presenting its financial study.
Extending Invitations for Practice

provisions.title: Article (64)
provisions.content:
The Committee shall extend an invitation for the submission of bids through Practice to the greatest number of those working in the type of activity subject of the practice, by letters sent by mail, fax, electronic means of communication or by any other means that ensures delivery of the invitation, and the invitation shall include all data that must have been mentioned in the announcement of the public tender.
In all cases, the number of invitees to the practice shall not be less than three companies.
Chapter Five
Competition

provisions.title: Article (65)
provisions.content:
Contracting through competition shall be conducted by a decision from the Head, upon a reasoned recommendation of the Committee.
The Committee shall announce the competition, provided that the announcement shall include the following:
Purposes, scope and detailed specifications of the project.
Value of the prizes or rewards granted to the winners, or compensations that can be granted to the rest of participants.
Standards and bases approved for preference between offers submitted to the competition.
Fate of the ownership of winning and non-winning studies, designs, drawings or prototypes.
Date and place of depositing offers that are the subject of competition.
The Committee, in coordination with the Competent Department, shall select and sort the winning offers, in accordance with the announced standards and bases.
The Committee may, upon the recommendation of the Competent Department, exempt the contestants from the value of the documents before the release.
Chapter Six
Direct Agreement
Direct Agreement Cases

provisions.title: Article (66)
provisions.content:
Contracting through direct agreement shall be made through a decision of the Head, upon a reasoned recommendation of the Committee, in the following cases:
Emergency cases.
Urgent cases.
If the required Items, works contracting or Services are available from only one source.
If the works contracting, Items or Services are required on trial basis.
If it is needed to test and purchase the required Items from the places of their production, because of their distinctive or monopolistic nature, which has no alternative.
When announcing, publishing and subscribing in newspapers, magazines, journals and other means of announcement, and purchasing books, scientific and cultural references necessary for the Government Body.
Works or Services of technical, cultural or training or creative nature, or related to marketing services.
In contracts for building, construction, infrastructure and the consulting services contracts related thereto, in which it is necessary to implement Works or Services that were not within the valid contract if the implementation of new Works by the same contractor is fundamental to ensure the safety of the executed Works the subject of the contract, on condition of the approval of the Minister in this case.
In the event of contracting through direct agreement in urgent cases, the Committee shall issue its recommendation by consensus of the opinions of its present members.
In all cases, it is required that the Government Body shall not be the cause of the availability of the urgent case.
Direct Agreement Requirements

provisions.title: Article (67)
provisions.content:
In cases of contracting through direct agreement, the Competent Department shall provide the Committee with the following:
Statement of the reasons and justifications that have led to the request of approval to contract through direct agreement.
Statement of the required Works in a specific and accurate manner, with specifications and conditions for implementation, the duration, the model of the contract to be concluded, and the value of the performance bond.
Technical presentation and price offer for contracting on the basis thereof.
Technical and financial study of the submitted offer and confirming that the offered prices are in accordance with the market prices, and a statement of the mechanism for the verification thereof. If the subject matter of the contract has been previously executed, the previous price and date of implementation must be indicated.
Statement of the annual consumption rate and the stored quantity of Items required to be purchased by direct agreement, if there are any, in case the items are supplied.
Exclusive agent certificate, if the Items, contracting Works or Services required to be contracted are available from only one source.
Confirming the availability of the financial allocation.
Contract without Presenting the Matter to the Committee

provisions.title: Article (68)
provisions.content:
As an exception to the provisions of Articles (63) and (66) of this Regulation, the Competent Department may contract by practice or direct agreement, without presenting the matter to the Committee, to purchase Items, implement works contracting or provide Services of a value not exceeding the maximum limit issued by a decision from the Head of the Council of Ministers for each body separately, upon the proposal of the Minister.
The Competent Department shall set up a working group of at least three members to carry out the contracts in accordance with the provision of this Article, in accordance with the rules specified by the Department. The recommendations of the working group shall be approved by the director of Competent Department or by the person designated by the Head according to the financial powers of the Government Body.
In this case, the payment may be through regular methods or through electronic credit cards.
The single deal shall not be divided into deals, so that the value of each one of them is within the mentioned amount limits.
The Government Body shall quarterly submit a report to the Department which includes all the contracts concluded in accordance with the provision of this Article, after complying with the forms prepared by the Department.
As an exemption of the provisions of the first and second paragraphs of this Article, the amount of expenses that do not require the submission of bids shall be specified by a decision of the Minister for each body separately, provided that such value shall not exceed (5%) five percent of the maximum limit stipulated in the first paragraph of this Article.
Part Three
Contracts Signing and Implementation
Notification of Award

provisions.title: Article (69)
provisions.content:
Taking into consideration the validity period of the bid, the secretariat of the Committee shall notify the Competent Department and the bidder of awarding the tender within (02) two working days from the date of approving its awarding recommendation.
The Commencement of Contract Implementation

provisions.title: Article (70)
provisions.content:
The period specified for the implementation of the contract shall start from the date of its signing unless otherwise agreed on, provided that it shall not exceed (90) ninety working days from the date of signing the contract.
In the contracts of works or Services, period of implementation of the contract starts from date of handing over the site to the contractor free of obstacles, during the period provided for in the first paragraph of this Article, and it may be extended for reasons beyond the control of one or both of the parties.
The contractor awarded the tender shall accomplish Work Contracting, supply Items or perform Services within the dates specified in the contract.
The Government Body shall appoint whom it selects to observe the accomplishment of the required works, and the contractor shall follow all guidelines instructed to him in this regard.

provisions.title: Article (71)
provisions.content:
If the tender is awarded to a non-Qatari company for the purpose of implementing a contract of Works Contracting or Services within the State, the latter shall take into account the provisions of the legislation in force in the State.
The Place of Items Delivery

provisions.title: Article (72)
provisions.content:
Delivery of Items shall be on the dates and at the places indicated in tables of quantities (prices list) according to the following:
If the delivery of Items is at the shipment port on the deck of the ship (FOB), the price indicated in the bid shall include transportation expenses to the deck of the ship.
If the delivery of Items is to the destination port (C&F), the price shall include shipment expenses.
If the delivery of Items includes shipment and insurance (CIF), the price, in addition to transportation expenses to the deck of the ship and value of shipment, shall include the insurance value.
If the delivery is at stores of Government Body (DDP), the price shall include all expenses including transportation, insurance, customs fees, taxes, stowage and other expenses, to the delivery site specified in the contract.
Supply of Items may be by any other method of delivery, in accordance with the unified rules of international shipping (INCOTERMS).
In all cases, the Competent Department shall not bear any additional amounts of any kind, except the total value agreed upon in the contract.
Delivery Date

provisions.title: Article (73)
provisions.content:
Taking into consideration the provision of the previous Article, the contractor shall supply the contracted Items on the specified date or dates to the stores of the Government Body or to the ones of any other Authority the former specifies, including all customs fees, port fees, taxes, transportation, discharge and stowage expenses and others.
Making Payments

provisions.title: Article (74)
provisions.content:
Quantities and weights mentioned in tables of quantity are approximate values subject to increase or decrease according to nature of works, provided that the payments are made on the basis of the actually implemented works, whether these works are less or more than the ones mentioned in the estimation or drawings, and whether the increase or decrease resulted from a mistake in the calculation of the primary estimation, or from changes made later in the work according to provisions of the contract. In package contracts that have contracted with the contractor on a specific contract price as a whole or on a specific price for each element or in each output of implementation outputs, payments are made in accordance with the provisions of the contract.
Provisional Receipt

provisions.title: Article (75)
provisions.content:
Supplied Items shall be received provisionally with knowledge of the Government Body, and the provisional receipt shall have no effect on the responsibility of the contractor for the supplied Items, until final receipt.
Inspection and Conformity

provisions.title: Article (76)
provisions.content:
The Government Body shall inspect the accomplished Items, work contracting or Services to know the extent of the conformity thereof with the required specifications or the samples submitted by the contractor, after notifying him of the date of inspection to enable him or his representative to attend the inspection process.
The contractor or his representative shall sign on the minutes of inspection, and the decision of the Government Body about the result of the inspection shall be effective, even if he failed to attend the inspection process in spite of his notification, or if he refrained from signing on the minutes, and the final receipt of the supplied Items shall be done after being accepted by the Government Body.
Defects Liability

provisions.title: Article (77)
provisions.content:
The contractor shall be liable for any defects that may appear in the Items, work contracting or Services, which are subject of the contract, after final receipt, if the Government Body realizes that failure to discover these defects at the time of receipt is due to fraud from the contractor, they are hidden defects or due to a defect in manufacturing.
The Rejected Items

provisions.title: Article (78)
provisions.content:
The contractor shall withdraw the rejected Items within a maximum period of fifteen days from date of notifying him of the rejection, and in case of his delay, he shall be committed to paying storage expenses at (1%) one percent of the Items value per delayed day and for a maximum period of thirty days.
After the elapsing of the referred to fifteen-day period, the Government Body has the right to sell the rejected Items in an auction at the expense of the contractor, provided that the possible dues of the contractor to the Government Body, whether they are fines or expenses, are deducted from the sales price, and the Government Body shall not be responsible for any damage to these Items for any reason till date of selling them with its knowledge or being withdrawn by the contractor.
Payment of Items, Work Contracting and Services Price

provisions.title: Article (79)
provisions.content:
The Government Body shall pay price of the contracted Items, works or Services, after their final receipt, and after fulfilling the following documents:
Invoices of the supplied Items or the accomplished work contracting and Services, and details of their prices, including a detailed list indicating the supplied Items, or the accomplished works and Services, attached with receipt notice or final accomplishment notice.
Bill of lading duly signed and approved as commonly recognized for the imported Items.
Insurance policy if the Items are imported from abroad, or nature of the implemented works entails being insured.
Country of origin certificate approved from the country exporting the materials in case of supply.
Delay Fines

provisions.title: Article (80)
provisions.content:
The contractor shall implement the contract within the specified dates, and in case of delay in the implementation of the contract or a part thereof on the specified date, the Government Body, in case of identifying an interest in that and upon the recommendation of the Committee, may give an additional time period to the contractor to complete the implementation, and it shall impose a fine for the delayed periods, in accordance with the following percentages and periods:
A fine per day or a part thereof, not exceeding ten percent (10%) of the total value of the contract.
A fine per delayed day of a maximum of ten percent (10%) of the value of the Items, work contracting or Services delayed in supply or implementation by the contractor, if the Government Body estimated that there is no relation with the contracted Items, work contracting or Services, and the delayed part of implementation or supply does not prevent the use of the rest of contracted Items, works contracting or Services.
In all cases, the imposition of the fine shall be without warning, notice or proof of occurrence of damage.
The contract shall be valid for the duration of the additional time limit period provided for in the first paragraph of this Article.
Adjusting Quantities or Volume of Contracts

provisions.title: Article (81)
provisions.content:
Upon the recommendation of the Committee and according to the requirements of the public interest, the Head may adjust the quantities or volume of the concluded contracts, in accordance with the provisions of the Law and this Regulation, upward or downward subject to the same conditions and prices, with a percentage not exceeding twenty percent (20%) of the contract value or its duration, and if the total amount of the adjustment exceeds the amount of (50,000,000) fifty million Riyals, the approval of the Minister must be obtained, and all of such shall be in accordance with the following controls:
The public interest necessitates that a new tender shall not be released, if the change is with increase.
The necessary financial allocations shall be available.
The adjustment shall be during implementation period of the works and before the commencement of maintenance or warranty period, and as an exception therefrom, the Head may, upon a reasoned recommendation of the Committee and with the approval of the contractor, adjust during period of the maintenance and warranty.
The adjustment shall be necessary and unexpected at the time of preparing conditions and specifications of the original tender.
Submitting the details and quantities of the request, indicating the bases and rules of pricing and attaching the original tender contract.
As an exception to the aforementioned adjustment percentage, it may, by a decision of the Head , based on a reasoned recommendation from the Committee, in urgent or emergency cases, to adjust the quantities or size of contracts for building, construction, infrastructure and related consulting services contracts, by an increase of more than (20%) twenty percent of the value or duration of the contract, subject to the approval of the Minister and the contractor, and the availability of financial allocations.
The Government Body may also, based on a reasoned recommendation from the Committee and with the approval of the contractor, adjust the quantities or size of the concluded contracts by reducing by more than (20%) twenty percent of the contract value or duration.
In all cases, the Competent Department shall study the request, evaluate it and make its reasoned recommendation thereon, and shall indicate the serial number of the request, its value and percentage of the total value of the contract, the total number of the previous changes made on the contract, and its values and percentages.
It is permissible in contracts for the supply of spare parts, if the public interest requires so, and without exceeding the aforementioned adjustment percentage in the first paragraph of this Article, and with the approval of the Committee with the unanimous opinion of its members present, that the adjustment includes the addition of spare parts from outside the contract, provided that the items are related to the subject matter of the original contract, and that the spare parts shall have a single source.
The calculation of the contracts quantity or size upward adjustment shall be separate from the downward adjustment, and it is not permissible to calculate the percentage of the net change orders nor to deduct the adjustment that have taken place by decrease from those that have taken place by increase.
After the approval of the Minister, the Department shall specify the percentage of the change orders allowed to be carried out by the government bodies without submitting them to the Committee.
Adjustment of Works Scope

provisions.title: Article (82)
provisions.content:
The quantities or size of the contracts provided for in the aforementioned Article shall not be adjusted unless the public interest so requires and with justifications acceptable to the Committee.
