The adjustment works shall not start executing except after obtaining a copy of the decision of the Head or the Minister, as the case may be, approving the adjustment, and the contractor shall not be entitled to claim any compensation if he carried out the execution before obtaining the aforementioned approval, even if his execution is based on orders for execution in violation of such provisions.
Down PaymentsArticle (83)
Upon an approval of the Head, and on a request of the Competent Department, down payments may be paid to the bidders, to a maximum limit of twenty percent (20%) of the total value of the contract, provided that to submit an unconditional bank letter of guarantee from one of the local or certified banks in the State against the value of the down payment, provided that such guarantee shall be valid until full payment of the down payment by deduction from his dues or against the accomplished works.
With the approval of the Minister, upon a request of the Head, the referred to percentage may be exceeded.
The Government Body shall specify the percentage of the down payment in tender conditions, according to the nature and importance of the project.
In the cases that the commencement of the implementation of the contract depends on the achievement of more than one fact, including the payment of the down payment, its payment shall not be done except after the achievement of all other facts.
Validity of Specifications and DrawingsArticle (84)
The contractor shall accurately investigate the validity of the approved specifications, drawings and designs, and their consistency with the works required to be implemented, and he has to notify the Government Body at the suitable time of his comments thereon.
Also, the contractor shall abide by the laws and regulations relevant to the contracting subject, and he shall be responsible for maintaining order at the worksite and implementing orders of the Government Body to exclude whoever neglects or refuses the implementation of instructions, and tries to deceive or violates the provisions and conditions of the contract.
Retention MoneyArticle (85)
The Competent Department in the contracting contracts, may retain a percentage not exceeding ten percent (10%) of the total value of the contract, which shall be announced in the tender conditions, as a guarantee for the implementation thereof, through the deduction of an amount equal to the same percentage supposed to be retained of each payment request, provided that to keep this amount with the Government Body.
The Competent Department shall return half the value of the retained amount, after the accomplishment of the works required to be carried out within seven working days from date of issuance of the primary accomplishment certificate without a request from the contractor, and the other half shall be kept until the expiration of maintenance or warranty period according to contract conditions.
The Competent Department may, upon the request of the contractor, refund no more than fifty percent (50%) of the value of the half of the value kept before the end of the period of maintenance or guarantee, provided that an unconditional bank guarantee letter of the same value shall be submitted from one of the local or accredited banks in the State.
Part Four
Items Selling and Properties and Chattels Renting
Methods of Selling and RentingArticle (86)
The Competent Department, upon approval of the Head, shall provide the inspection and evaluation committee with a list of Items intended to be sold or rented, or properties intended to be rented.
After specifying the basic value, prior to the announcement of the selling or renting auctions, the Competent Department shall notify the Committee to follow one of the following methods:
Public auction, and in the announcement of public auction the Items intended to be sold or rented, or the properties intended to be rented, and time and place specified for performing the auction and method and conditions of delivery shall be clarified.
Sealed envelopes auction, which shall be announced in the same method of announcing the public tender, and in the announcement the Items intended to be sold or rented, or the properties intended to be rented shall be clarified.
Inspection and Evaluation CommitteeArticle (87)
Inspection and evaluation committee provided for in Article (26) of the Law, shall inspect and evaluate Items and specify the rental value of properties and chattels before offering them for sale or rent, and specify tender bond value, and its recommendations on the feasibility extent of bid release and the method of release.
The mentioned committee in evaluation of Items or specifying rental value of properties and chattels, intended to be sold or rented, shall be guided by market price, selling price or previous renting, and other effective elements, and this estimation is considered as basic price for selling or renting.
Inspection and evaluation committee shall submit the basic value in a sealed and confidential envelope, or by any other means that guarantees its confidentiality, to the Head of the Committee before the bid release and notify the Competent Department with the tender bond value, and its recommendations on the feasibility extent of bid release and the method of release.
Selling or Renting PriceArticle (88)
Each bidder shall pay a tender bond in accordance with the provisions and procedures of tender bond applied on the public tender.
For public auction, the bidder, who was awarded the auction or a part thereof, shall pay, in cash, down payment of the price specified in the announcement, and he shall pay the rest of the selling value within a period not exceeding two working days from date of the award.
The bidder, in renting auctions, shall pay a performance bond of not less than ten percent (10%) of the total value of the contract, in accordance with the conditions and provisions applied on public tender.
In contracts of selling of Items that their value is paid according to their weight, and the total quantity sold thereof cannot be specified beforehand, value of the performance bond is specified as a percentage of the total value of the quantities expected to be received within the term of contract, in accordance with the prices submitted by the bidder.
Renting PeriodArticle (89)
The rental period at a time shall not exceed three years.
As an exception, however, the Committee may exceed this period if the use of the rented property requires the spending of large amounts of money by the bidder, or if this achieves better financial return to the State.
In all cases, before expiration of contract term by at least ninety (90) days, release procedures must have been initiated again.
Auction Awarding Article (90)
The Committee shall award the auction to the bidder of the highest price, who fulfilled the conditions, provided that it will not be less than the basic value, and the application of the bidder to the auction is considered to be an acknowledgement from his part of full inspection of auction Items or properties, the subject of the auction, with due diligence.
The Committee may divide the auction between more than one bidder according to the highest prices, if the public interest so requires.
If the auction is cancelled for any of the reasons stipulated in Article (29) of the Law, the Committee may rerelease the auction after reducing its basic value, as agreed on with the inspection and evaluation committee.
Selling or Renting through Practice or Direct AgreementArticle (91)
With a reasoned decision from the Head, upon a recommendation of the Committee, selling or renting may be done through direct agreement or practice, in any of the following cases:
In urgent or emergency cases that do not assume to follow the auction procedures.
If there is no offer submitted to the auction.
If the Items cannot be released in a competitive auction either for their low value, quick damage, high value of their storage or their basic value is less than the cost of their announcing.
In all cases, the selling or renting value shall not be less than the basic value estimated by the inspection and evaluation committee provided for in Article (26) of the Law.
Payment of Selling or Renting ValueArticle (92)
The winner of the auction by sealed envelopes shall pay full value of the Items or the due installment of the rental value, within seven working days from date of notifying him of the auction award. Rental value shall be paid in periodic installments in advance every six months.
In case he defaults on payment without acceptable excuse, the Head may, upon the recommendation of the Committee, cancel the award and confiscate tender bond or performance bond, as the case may be, without prejudice to the right of the Government Body to claim any other compensations from him.
The Competent Department, in coordination with the Requesting Department, shall deliver the sold Items, or rented properties or Items to the winning bidder, after making sure of paying its total value or due installment of the rental value.
Selling by WeightsArticle (93)
In contracts of selling Items that their value is estimated by their weight, and their weight cannot be specified beforehand, quantities and weights offered for sale shall be considered under the deficit and excess, and the essential is that determination of sold final quantities will result from the actual delivery thereof, and Items value shall be paid according to actually delivered quantities, and to the special prices on the basis of which the auction was awarded.
Selling or Renting Items for the Government Body Contractors

provisions.title: Article (94)
provisions.content:
The Competent Department, after approval of the Committee, may sell Items or rent equipment, through direct agreement, to the Government Body contractors, if the contract so stipulates, and the purpose of their selling or renting is to use them in the implementation of the body’s projects and for its interests.
Receipt of Items

provisions.title: Article (95)
provisions.content:
The auction winner shall receive the total sold Items within the period specified in auction documents, and if he delayed to do so without acceptable excuse, he shall pay storage expenses of one percent (1%) of the value of the Items that he has not received per delayed day and for a maximum of fifteen days, after that the Items will be sold in auction at his own expense.
In this case, he shall bear the value of decrease in price, storage expenses and administrative expenses of the percentage of ten percent (10%) of value of the new sale price, and any achieved increase in the sale price shall not be paid back to him.
Part Five
Classifying Contractors and Evaluating their Performance
Commitment to Dealing with The Classified

provisions.title: Article (96)
provisions.content:
The Bodies subject to provisions of the Law and this Regulation, in order to obtain what they need of contracting works, Services or supply, shall deal with the contractors, suppliers and service providers classified in different specializations and categories in accordance with their financial capabilities, technical expertise, competence and previous works, taking into consideration the following:
Tender announcement shall include the specification of the specialization and category specified for each type of works contracting, supply or Services, according to the financial limits determined by the Department.
Tender announcement may include a statement that allows the application of companies of higher category to participate in the lower category tenders, provided that this will be done between two consecutive categories.
Those Bodies may transact with foreign companies that are not classified in the State, provided that they submit a classification certificate, or its equivalent, issued by the State in which the company was established, and ratified from the embassy of Qatar in the establishing State, and according to controls that the Department sets.
The natural persons may be exempted from the classification requirement. A decision by the Head may exempt non-Qatari companies in cases of contracting through direct agreement or practice and in supply tenders from the classification requirement, provided that the Committee will be notified of this decision.
The Department Competences in Classifying the ContractorsArticle (97)
The Department, regarding classifying the contractors, is responsible for the following:
Preparing classification system for the contractors in all specializations, and shall include the following:
Evaluation elements.
Points.
Point distribution tables.
Determinants, conditions and mechanism of classification.
Contractor data.
Procedures of application evaluation.
Studying and evaluating data and information submitted by the contractors applying for classification.
Examining and studying contractors' applications for adjusting their classification to higher categories or adding new specializations to theirs.
Carrying out the required studies to add new specializations to the existing ones.
The Department Competences in Evaluating PerformanceArticle (98)
The Department, regarding evaluating the performance of the contractors and suppliers or service providers, is responsible for providing database about their performance in different State projects, through preparing a unified form to evaluate the performance by the government Bodies, that have previously contracted with them, to be evaluated on unified bases in application of performance, transparency and equality criteria, and which contributes to the achievement of the following:
Accomplishing State projects with the required quality and at the specified time.
Selecting the best contractors, suppliers and service providers through a performance report, which indicates their level.
Linking the performance level of contractors, suppliers and service providers with the classification system.
Equally improving performance quality of both government bodies and companies.
Knowing the volume and value of works awarded to local and foreign contractors and suppliers and service providers with the knowledge of the government Bodies and providing accurate data about them.
Fields of Contracting Subject to ClassificationArticle (99)
The contractor shall be classified in one or more of the following fields:
Different civil contracting (buildings, bridges, dams, tunnels, concrete constructions, steel structures).
Maintenance of different types of buildings.
Road, sanitary drainage and water works.
Agricultural works.
Any specializations updated in the future by a decision from the Department.
Documents and Data Required for ClassificationArticle (100)
The contractor, when applying for classification or reclassification, shall submit to the Department the following documents and data:
Extract from the commercial register.
Financial status of the company through data or a budget audited by an auditor.
Administrative and technical staff supported by educational certificates, CVs, work period of each of them, and list of the number of existing workers, approved by the competent authorities.
List of company's equipment and cars, approved by the Traffic Department, supported with copies of their registration cards, and list of stationary equipment owned by the company, provided that they are approved by an auditor.
Practical experience of the contractor according to the works he implemented, provided that the projects' contracts and accomplishment certificates are attached, indicating name and value of the project, and starting and ending dates.
Any other documents or data that the Department deems necessary to be submitted.
Mechanism of Submitting Classification ApplicationArticle (101)
Classification or reclassification applications shall be submitted electronically through the unified website for the State procurement, including data and documents stipulated in the previous Article.
The Department shall examine the classification and reclassification application and make sure that the applicant has fulfilled all the referred to data and documents, and to this end, it may move to companies’ headquarters and worksites in cases that require to do so.
The applicant classification shall be in accordance with the criteria, percentages and determinants issued by a decision from the Minister, upon a proposal of the Department.
Deciding on The Classification ApplicationArticle (102)
The Department shall decide on classification applications submitted thereto within fifteen working days from the date of the completion of the applicant of all the requirements stipulated in this Regulation.
The Department shall hand over the classification certificate to the applicant within seven working days from the date of its issuance, and he may raise a grievance against the classification decision to the Minister within seven working days from the date of receiving the certificate.
The Minister shall decide on the grievance within fifteen days from the date of his submission, and the expiration of the period referred to without a response shall be considered an implied rejection of the grievance and deciding on the grievance decision shall be final.
The classified may ask the Department to reconsider the decision of the classification thereof. In case the submission of that application was before the passing of six months on the issuance of the classification decision, the classified shall pay twice the amount of the fee for issuing the classification certificate.
Updating The Classification DataArticle (103)
The Department, at any time, may request the classified to update his respective classification data.
The Department shall notify the classified to submit his updated data within the period it identifies therefor.
The failure of the classified to fulfill the referred to obligations, shall lead to expiration of validity of the classification certificate granted to him.
The Classified Adjustment of the Legal Position thereofArticle (104)
The classified, upon taking any legal action that leads to the adjustment in his legal position which affects the category or fields he has been classified therein, shall notify the Department of such adjustment within fifteen days from date of taking such action.
The failure of the classified to fulfill the referred to obligations shall lead to expiration of validity of the classification certificate granted to him.
In all cases, the Department shall reclassify according to the classified's new legal position.
Issuance of Classification CertificateArticle (105)
After fulfilling the prescribed fee, the Department shall issue a certificate of classification, either by regular or electronic means, which indicates the classified’s name, certificate's serial number, specializations and categories in which he has been classified.
The certificate shall be valid for two years from the issuance date thereof.
Classification shall be cancelled if it is submitted based on incorrect information or documents on the financial, technical or administrative status of the classified.
The Applicability of the Contractor Classification Provisions to the Supplier
and Service Provider Article (106)
The rules, controls and procedures set forth in this part shall apply to the classification of suppliers and service providers in different categories and specializations in a way that complies with the nature of supply and service provision.
The Unified Website for the State Procurement Article (107)
A website called "The Unified Website for the State Procurement " shall be established through which the Department shall develop a government procurement system and collect a database therefor. Government Bodies subject to the provisions of the Law shall be obliged to announce such site the tenders and the results of opening and awarding envelopes, and to provide any data deemed necessary for the Department to make them available on the website.
The Department shall prepare a list on the aforementioned website, including contractors against whom a decision was issued to stop dealing therewith by any Government Body, for any of the reasons provided for in the Law or Regulation, or based on performance evaluation reports, in accordance with the controls set by the Department therefor.
The Department may stop the tenders in which the bodies did not comply with the offering procedures and announce the decisions on the unified website for State procurement.
Procedures and Forms Article (108)
The Department shall determine the procedures and shall establish the necessary forms for the implementation of this Regulation in coordination with the government Bodies, which shall abide by those procedures and forms with a view to standardizing and simplifying the procedures.
Part Six
Supporting Small and Medium-sized Companies
Exemptions Offered to Small and Medium-sized Companies.

provisions.title: Article (108)
provisions.content:
/ Bis)
Tenders whose value is less than (1,000,000) one million Riyals, national micro-sized companies shall be exempted from providing Tender and Performance bond.
Micro, small and medium-sized companies shall be exempted from paying the value of tender documents whose value is less than (1,000,000) one million Riyals.
Micro and small-sized companies shall pay half of the prescribed fee for classification.
The determination of micro, small and medium-sized companies shall be in accordance with the provisions of the aforementioned Minister of Economy and Trade decision No. (250) of 2018.
The Minister may adjust the amounts provided for in this Article.
Restricting Contracting to Small or Medium Companies
Article (108/ Bis 1)
In tenders that the value thereof is less than (5,000,000) five million Riyals, the Government Body may limit participation therein to micro, small, or medium-sized companies, or all of them, that are classified in the Ministry.
